website_summaries.verdict: A great travel mouse pad to keep around for a sturdy grip on slippery surfaces.
pros: Heavy-duty rubber base keeps the pad from sliding around when used for travel
Stitched edging offers more durability and a little more support for the wrist
Can be used for all mice
cons: Takes up some space in travel bags and luggage

customer_reviews.title: Do not hesitate to get this mouse pad, if the size is right for you.  It should be the right size for just about anyone.
customer_reviews.text: I am not often given to hyperbole, but this is one of the best mouse pads I've ever used at any price, and I've used some high-end, gaming-peripheral-brand gaming mouse pads. But I hope that reviews such as this don't drive up the price, because the price I paid made it an extraordinarily good deal.
customer_reviews.author: D. Apfel

customer_reviews.title: A simply mat mouse pad is good enough
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a City of Villain mouse pad. It worked but the bottom would slide on the desk. After years of using it, decided to get a new mouse pad. A few months ago I got my kid a RGB mouse pad.. Man, too much lights and it just distracted the hell out of me. The kid loves it though. So I came looking for a simply mat moue pad and found this one. It is simple but does the job. No complain here.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tong

customer_reviews.title: Maybe good quality?
customer_reviews.text: Well it's like any other mouse pad, sticky (gripy) on one side, and slick on the other. My table is so smooth that it barely grips on and ends up sliding sometimes through. Also, though I don't use a lot of space for my mouse since I run my mouse at a high sensitivity, my wrist ends up rubbing against the stitched edges, which gets annoying after a while. Also, the place where the edge stitching stops is very noticeable and almost seems to be coming out. I hope it is knotted and that the string poking up is just excess after the knot.
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: A Great Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice mouse pad. It is a great size and feels good. Not thin and "cheap". I was a little leary when I ordered it but it turned out to be a really nice mouse pad. The edges are even hemmed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Price

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to Steel Series. Amazing mousepad for ~$5.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality for the price. Looks like different weave pattern from the Steel Series but it's also amazingly tight and smooth. It has just a little bit more friction than the steel series, but I actually prefer that for better mouse control (I actually placed this mousepad on top of my Qck Mass). This is way better than any regular cloth mouse pads you can find at the big box stores, and on par with the professional gaming ones. The stitched edge is also a plus, which Steel Series lack for durability.
customer_reviews.author: Ran Zhao

customer_reviews.title: Good but sharp edges.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the pad itself, the material is phenomenal! It is thin but very soft and works perfect. I just really don't like the way I res my wrist on the edges they are hard and in one spot specifically there is a piece that is sharp. It likes to poke me from time top time. But for the price I paid I can't be too upset with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Watson

customer_reviews.title: Durable Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: I hate shredded mouse pads! This one will hold up well with its stitched edges, and the material is somewhat slick, making it easy for the mouse to glide over the surface. It's a perfect, no-frills, do-the-job product. I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: MizDee

customer_reviews.title: Too thin and looks dirty right away
customer_reviews.text: These pads are solid black and really thin. I like a thicker mouse pad than this thin little thing. I didn't think about the black color at the time of purchase but within a few days, it looked filthy from just my hand moving the mouse across the pad. I will not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie P. Moses

customer_reviews.title: Better off without it
customer_reviews.text: No clue what the problem is with mouse pad, but my mouse works about 10X better without it. The mouse just will not track properly with this pad.
customer_reviews.author: AKokay

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I've been using for weeks and can say a few things. First, the non-slip backing works. Second, the mouse surface provides excellent resolution for an optical mouse. Third, the upward-facing fabric is nice on the skin, where your wrist makes contact. I've pretty much ignored the logo on it. Actually... of course... I don't spend much time looking at the image, either. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Spector

customer_reviews.title: Erratic jumpy mouse movement
customer_reviews.text: I bought the VicTsing mouse and expected that combo would work best. I thought the mouse was defective and they sent me a replacement but with this mouse pad had the same erratic movement. My old mouse works worse on this mouse pad then my ragged old mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kane

customer_reviews.title: After 10 minutes it was in my trash can
customer_reviews.text: Extremely thin mouse pad that make a noise like fingers on a chalk board as mouse moves across it. After 10 minutes of this, it went right into the trash. I will continue using my old pad until I find something better. It goes to show that even if something is rated best seller, it is not always a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to rub wrist and arm on but doesn't slide on desk
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't slide around on my desk and is smooth in the middle for mouse movements. However, the fabric is thin, so no cushioning of wrist, the stitched edging and texture of middle rubs uncomfortably against my wrist and arm as I move the mouse and is bothering me with use, feels like I will eventually get a sort of rug burn. The fabric seems good quality but not comfortable to rub against all work day.
customer_reviews.author: Dusterlea

customer_reviews.title: Awful. Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. Mouse wouldn't work on this. I know.... But it's true. IT WOULDN'T WORK
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: A nice big pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a bigger than expected mouse pad. I admit that I did not check the measurements in detail, but have never owned a mouse pad that is about 1 1/2 times larger the pads I have used over the years. Meaning it cannot be used with my present desk configuration. The stitching around the outer edges is a nice finish and gives the pad a little protective bumper. The pad is slightly thin but doesn't effect the performance of the mouse on it. The VicTsing symbol and name could have been less prominently printed on the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Cyhber Sr

customer_reviews.title: Stitching error
customer_reviews.text: Did not notice at first but small stitching error on edge. Wouldnt mind except it rhbs my wrist and hurts after time.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Piller

customer_reviews.title: One of those things that I didn't know would be useful until I tried it
customer_reviews.text: I'd been having some trouble with mouse movement and I think it may have been that I was using an old Max Payne 2 promo pad I got with the game years ago... this one is larger, thinner, and just seems to help. One of those things that I didn't know would be useful until I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: E Thorn

customer_reviews.title: Edges curled
customer_reviews.text: I like that this pad is relatively thin, and doesn't slide around on my desk. However, when I first received it one edge was slightly curled up, and it has gotten worse with time. Both long edges are now curled upwards, as can be seen in the photo I provided. To their credit, when I contacted the seller regarding the curl that I first noticed, they offered a partial refund. I appreciated their offer, although I did not take advantage of it, as I assumed the pad would eventually flatten out.
customer_reviews.author: SteveL

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with laser mouse
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason, my laser mouse has a hard time detecting movement over the surface of this mouse pad. Dragging the mouse across the pad produces slow and inconsistent movement of the cursor, compared to the smooth and consistent cursor movement I get from moving the mouse across my desk. I don't know if it's because the mouse pad surface is a little bit glossy, or what, but I'm basically going to throw it away, because it's useless for its stated purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I Love It
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is just perfect for what I wanted. The print of the galaxy is beautiful; the mouse laser tracks perfectly on it; it's smooth and feels good to touch; the edge is reinforced with high-quality stitching; and it's just the right size for me to go back and forth between my two monitors without having to awkwardly pick up the mouse mid-movement. I don't use it for gaming, but I do work on the computer for a living, and I use both a cheap and an expensive mouse on it. The price is very good, too. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good simple mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: sometimes you dont need a lot of features. you just need something simple that works. this is that mouse pad. its simple. it works. it doesnt roll up while you are trying to use it. it lays flat. it doesnt slide all over the place because it has a non slip back. wish my rugs in my house had this backing. it doesnt have a big annoying wrist rest. its just a flat piece of material with a sewn edge. probably wouldnt work well under water (lol) and I wouldnt recommend putting hot stuff out of the oven on it. but thats not what its for! lol. - you know someone will try...
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Franklin III

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mousepad
customer_reviews.text: I know what you are thinking. All mouse pads are the same - just something to have your mouse roll over, or scan with that awesome laser, or just protect your desk or table or whatever your mouse is on. This one is different. It has a great feel to it. The mouse works perfectly on it - never missing a beat, whether I'm just on the internet, or involved in heavy gaming. The stitching is great and rubberized backing is spot on. Excellent quality that I'm sure will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JCStuff

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw gimps the effective range of this mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I never realized I'd be a mouse pad snob until today. I had been taking a "feature" of normal mouse pads for granted: Usually the mouse can slide over the edge of the mouse pad and still function normally without screwing with your aim. Not so for this one. The seams are raised and will stop your mouse as soon as it comes into contact with a border, which limits the range of the mouse. This is of course partially compensated by the large area of the mouse pad, but it's still bothersome to a degree. Also mine had a very small stain on it, indicating it was used even though I bought new.
customer_reviews.author: Max Loh

customer_reviews.title: So smooth!
customer_reviews.text: A perfect size mousepad for my needs. A huge upgrade from my cheap mousepad I got at a local pharamacy store. My logitech mouse slides so easily and it feels so smooth. I recommend picking one up. Only one con, it smells pretty bad when opening up the clear plastic packaging for the first time. BUT the smell has faded away.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Quality matches price
customer_reviews.text: Really thin and flimsy, the corners are slightly curled up from the stitching. I actually bought this stitched pad so that the covering wouldn't peel up like my last one, but now I find myself struggling with the corners rolling up when I move my mouse/wrist. Also smells musty which makes my hand noticably smell. Will probably order something else soon, but not terrible considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Non-slip?  not even close
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic mouse pad and I'm not sure what I expected for around $5. it helps a bit with the accuracy of my mouse, especially in games but that's offset by the fact that is as far from non slip as you can get. Unfortunately even though the surface is great for a mouse, it moves around the desktop so much you end up having to readjust the pad constantly and that's not good. With gaming that's rather important too. if you need a mouse for some better accuracy and speed in games, look elsewhere. 3 stars because for basic use it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: s4ndm4n2006

customer_reviews.title: How does it earn a four and half star for this rubbish?
customer_reviews.text: I really don't get how it's got almost five star for this pad. It really smells and the smell doesn't go away after weeks. The pad doesn't feel good either in terms of sensitivity and accuracy (tested using the same mouse). This mouse pad feels horrible and is basically a junk compared to the other Steel Series mouse pad I have. So my piece of advice is that, if you really want a good mouse mat, just spend only five more bucks on a much much better Steel Series pad. Gosh, the smell is really bad even when I'm typing this right now...
customer_reviews.author: Zhexing Li

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is a great price and it also works. I was looking for a thin mousepad as my Apple Magic Mouse doesn't work on my glass desk. Some reviews say that the seam is uncomfortable, but I just turned the mousepad vertical and I don't even encounter it. I find the boarder to be thin enough that I don't even notice it. The mouse pad does stay in place, but it isn't completely non-slip. It stays in place when using a mouse, but it does move very easily when tapped from the side. Depending on your needs, this may be what you're looking for or you may want a heavier mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Adam T.

customer_reviews.title: Nice appearance and generous size.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mousepad on the off chance that it would improve performance of the fancy-but-glitchy wireless mouse we purchased a few months ago. I ordered a new wireless mouse along with the mouse pad. If the mousepad solved the problem with the old mouse, I was going to return the new mouse. One way or the other, I was going to get a well-functioning mouse. So, the mouse pad didn't help the old mouse (no surprise) but the new mouse works perfectly. This mouse pad appears to be just fine and we're going to keep it around in case we need it later.
customer_reviews.author: Patilu

customer_reviews.title: Great little mousepads!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the two pack, black and space themed, and they're alright. Better than the last mouse pad I used in 2009 for sure. They don't slide around, the stitching around the outside isn't irritating, and the surface is smooth. The black one definitely shows dirt and grime, but it seems to be machine washable, though you might just rinse it in the sink and scrub it with a very gentle brush instead. Bottom line, this isn't an AMAZING, earth-shattering product, but it works as described, and I don't regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would think this highly of a mouse pad. I am in a hospital bed and the table the pad rest on has a film of medicated powder on it. Last pad always slide around. It was easy to move the mouse off old pads. This pad stays in place. Is large enough to easily use from a hospital bed. This pad does not move around. The mouse stays on the pad and works great. The pad has a small outer ridge that lets you know you have reached the edge with a feel. I highly recommend this. Now lets see how long it stays working this well.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but...
customer_reviews.text: Very similar print design to the 3M sticky mousepad. The stitching along the edge leaves a bit to be desired. And appears it would eventually fray. At this price point you may want to consider a better pad for a little more but at the same time, by the time this is looking raggedy you can replace it for cheap. I eventually went with a very big mouse pad from Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nooen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mouse pad for my kids!
customer_reviews.text: There is not much to say other than this is a quality mouse pad that is perfect for my kids, now that they are in virtual school because of covid-19 I had to setup 2 different class areas for them, I did not want to get a boring mouse pad so I'm glad I got these, the colors are really vivid and the kids love them, they have good weight and do not feel cheap at all, they bottom grip is very good and they do not slide! all in all this is the perfect mouse pad with great graphics that your kids will love!
customer_reviews.author: Dan V

customer_reviews.title: Mouse pad is great, wrist rest is too small and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The mouse pad sticks to the table and works well. Buts let's be honest, how can you get a mouse pad wrong? The wrist rest is pretty garbage. I am a big person and this barely goes across the width of my wrist. It moves too much and I can't use the size of the pad. Still, it is cheap and I was not looking for a wrist rest but a cheap mouse pad so I got what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: mathfordragons

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: I am a full time student and a hobby gamer and recently I got a new desk with a white surface, which sucks for gaming since the white reflects enough light for mice to not work properly. This mouse pad is the perfect size, looks small but works with my dual monitor set up with a comfortable mouse sensitivity. The rubber on the bottom doesn't let the mouse pad move around. Plus, the way it's made, it keeps its flatness. It shipped and got bent in shipment and as soon as I pulled it from the package it immediately went flat.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Shiflet

customer_reviews.title: love this mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I know I gave it two starts for gaming but I don't game with my computers and I just wanted to make that clear! But the reasoning I gave that two stars and not 5 is because I feel like you just need a bigger mouse pad for gaming, like a desk pad type mouse pad, lol. It does what it needs to do when it comes to using the computer normally! I love it so much, use it for two mouses at the same time (mouse for my desktop and mouse for my laptop) love it even more since it matches my laptop case!
customer_reviews.author: Brie Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality, a bit small for gaming, can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's a smooth thin mouse pad of office-compatible size, nothing fancy. It works better than a notebook and is perfectly functional for everyday use. I am not much of a gamer, but when I play I sometimes find the mouse moving out of the edge. Not a big problem for me, but it would be frustrating for intense combat games. No slippage due to the backing, that doesn't stick or damage a wooden table. No wrist support or other niceties. You get what you pay for. It could be worse.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: so-so mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting for my desktop desk and while I was waiting, I was using my glass table as my desk for my pc setup and because of the slippery surface, I bought this mouse pad since it had good reviews. My desk came after a week. I have been continuously using this mouse pad since I bought this product. The mouse experience is nice overall but the mouse pad itself does not give any rest to your palm. So if you use a mouse for a long time, this may not be the best option. But for the budget, this may be one of the good options.
customer_reviews.author: SaveMoney

customer_reviews.title: GREAT value, quality stitching. 5 star value/perform. that gets a -1 as cosmic one had a misprint.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value, perfect size for me (not a big fan of huge mousepads) surface is flat, soft and stitching isn't abrasive on wrists. I believe it is a 5-star product, the reason i gave it 4 stars is because the space/cosmic one i got had a straight washed off color line from what it looks like some sort of color transfer issue. I am still using the black one and kept the cosmic one as backup but wished it would have been printed properly as it looks beautiful in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Satorikn

customer_reviews.title: Great little mousepad
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Victsing mousepad. I got a giant one that covers my desk for gaming and the quality is really nice, I needed a smaller mousepad for another desk and bought this one. Really good quality, it sticks to the desk and doesn't shift around. The stitching along the outer edge is superb. The printed pattern looks good and it has a nice smooth feel to it. Overall I'm very happy with both of my Victsing mousepads and would buy again in the future if I need another mousepad.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Normal sized Not for gaming lil pricey for what ya get.
customer_reviews.text: It's described as bigger than a normal pad and great for gaming. This is a very sad moment cause I have to get another pad for gaming as a basic responsive normal size pad it works great at that. I can only give 3 star cause one it's price is lil high for the lack of qaulity stitching and material used. I could've got a similar pad here at Walmart or even my local electronics place for 3 bucks they were actually lil thicker and tracked the same. I only bought this cause this was described as a pad good for gaming and bigger than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G.

customer_reviews.title: Good budget mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my the purpose for gaming and entertainment. I needed something cheap decent in quality. This one fits the bill and so far I am satisfied. It is reasonably big for the price and not paper thin like most other cheap mouse pads out there. It does get the job done. Imo the braided bezels are a it raised if you dont have anything under your wrist. You can feel the bump and you can expect wear and tear over time. Overall not a big deal!
customer_reviews.author: Jerico

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse pad except for durability! Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 7-20: Reached out to customer service and they promptly refunded. Five stars for customer service, even after warranty ended but with minimal usage. ORIGINAL: This mouse pad has been perfect for work from home, however, after only a couple months of use is already fraying/discoloring where my palm sits. I expect a bit more out of a mouse pad given typical expectancies! Look elsewhere rather than throw $8 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Life Generalist

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good quality and price.
customer_reviews.text: I was originally skeptical when I saw this mouse. I wondered if its playability would be a problem. However, it was not. The pad sits snugly on my desk and does not stick. It's easy to reposition, but stay put when repositioned. It's soft on the wrist. Good quality material and well sewn around the edge. The mouse operates smoothly and no lags as with my previous mouse pad. I am liking this pad very much so far. I will update this post, if need be. I will recommend this pad.
customer_reviews.author: ARTJ

customer_reviews.title: Budget Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have a permanent on the go mouse pad to pair with my laptop. I use this for some light gaming and internet browsing while I have down time at work, of which there is an abundance. A plus of this pad is it won't make your wallet cry because you wasted your hard earned labor on extraneous branding when you could've just gotten a VicTsing (man that is a painful brand name though) and enjoyed the benefits of wisdom. It is more in line with the smooth silky feeling tactile sensations as textures go, so if you're into that rough canvas texture you may want to browse some other budget boios.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad for the price though
customer_reviews.text: Very thin mouse pad. It slides a little bit around my desk over a period of a few hours. Can't really complain for the price though. I wish it was thicker or grippier. However, I have discovered that the company VicTsing is very supportive of their products. They found out that I was unsatisfied this this mouse pad, and they offered me the larger one instead (). If you can afford the desk space, then I'd say go for the big one. It doesn't slid around at all because of the large surface area and there is extra space to put peripherals (i.e. phone, tablet, etc.) rather than on the hard desk.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: An very good mousepad
customer_reviews.text: A mouse pad is hardly an expensive purchase but it is a relatively important one. This pad is very well-made. The non-slip bottom is not to sticky so as to be hard to move. It is a generous size and the edges have a finished stitched look. The surface is a fine grained texture. It does provide drag on the mouse a little, maybe too much for gaming. For the graphics-intensive work I do, it works quite well providing a lot of fine mouse control. For the price it is very nice pad.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Brown

customer_reviews.title: It's a mouse pad!
customer_reviews.text: Reading some of the reviews and I find it fascinating that so many folks have so many things to say about a mouse pad! I got this to replace the vinyl placemat I was using previously. It's normal mouse pad-sized, seems to stay put on a varnished wood table and I do like the stitched edges as peeling of the top surface has almost always been the end of my previous mouse pads. I also like that it's thin. A good, solid, basic, no-nonsense mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mousepad for the price, but.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this mouse pad is great. Extra smooth surface and the harder padding is not as thick as a "standard" mouse pad. However, there is a stitched border that runs around the pad and where the stitching ends, it looks and feels like the nylon stitching was melted to prevent fraying. This is okay, but your hand and wrist can rub across it which is very annoying. If the border was removed, it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mouse pad.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice mouse pad. Replaces a hard plastic one that warped and would not go back to shape. This on is soft and flexible to hold but once down on the desktop is lie flat and the mouse moves very smoothly. It has stitching all around the sides so it will probably not unravel or fray.
customer_reviews.author: RGB

customer_reviews.title: Love the stitched edges
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the most durable mouse pads I’ve ever used. The edge stitching is the best thing about it. Everyone knows the feeling of mouse pads tearing and peeling. Glad this might be my last mouse pad haha. But for sure one of the best but economically phenomenol.
customer_reviews.author: Hoa T.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well and stayed put
customer_reviews.text: This mousepad worked well and stayed put for the couple hours I used it. However I discovered the hard way that this product is made with natural rubber and contains latex. I now have a painful rash on my arm and hand where they rested on the mousepad during use. If you are allergic to latex steer clear of this item! Seller was very responsive and issued a refund. Hopefully they add the warning that it contains latex to the listing.
customer_reviews.author: Ducky

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend to get this mouse pad If you need one.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this mouse pad for every reason ever since I first laid on my eyes on It. The mouse pad Is big enough where you don't have any issue of not having enough space. Sliding around the mouse Is very silky smooth I don't play games very much but, the few times I use this mouse pad It Is very smooth and responsive. It looks very high quality even for the low price of $5.99 It doesn't slip around very much plus It's waterproof. I purposely spilled water on the mouse pad and It's pretty water resistant It dried up pretty quickly and didn't damage the mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Silva

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: bought this because i needed a new mouse pad. i didn't want to spend $3 at walmart for some rubbery flimsy mess with a plastic cover so i got this one. i have to say, my only real complaint is that it's only about .08mm thick, so it feels like i'm resting my wrist on the desk. the stitching is really well done, and the pad itself is soft and supple. best of all i've got a gaming mouse and i use a pretty high dpi (2400) and i do not have problem with lag or response times with this mousepad. Definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Irvan

customer_reviews.title: Should be named “mouse surfboard” instead
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad had one job. One job to serve as a pad for my mouse and not as a surfboard. If you want to see your mouse go surfing on your desk as you desperately try to control it, this is the product for you. If you actually want to own a mouse pad that grips to the table and doesn’t move a millimeter as you try hard to snipe someone in COD with your sweaty hands, stay away from this product.

customer_reviews.title: Good mousepad for most
customer_reviews.text: I gave this mousepad a try for several days, but unfortunately my skin would be easily irritated by the sewn edges. Getting a wrist pad would have probably alleviated this problem for me, but VicTsing beat me to the punch and replaced the pad with another one of their products that has a wrist pad built in. Both products have had smooth tracking of the mouse. To top things off, VicTsing has quality Customer Service that stands by their products, and I'll be keeping them in mind when I make my next computer purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rehpyc

customer_reviews.title: Catboy got the Mouse! .... pad.
customer_reviews.text: The price was good, the quality is good, so far everything is working very well! No distracting image on the mouse pad, just a nice black color and very smooth fabric. This makes gaming a lot easier honestly, probably should have ordered this mouse pad sooner! We are very glad we ordered this, especially after looking at other more expensive mouse pads which really didn't do anything other than being more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Meowstopheles

customer_reviews.title: Excellent material. Perfect traction for precise control.
customer_reviews.text: I'm hesitant to buy clothing online, mostly because in years past, the images were never great and proportions and labeled sizes are still often "hit or miss" for me. Mousepads also have been in that category. I can't tell you how many times, I purchased one to find out the material is too slippery or feels odd against the palm of my hand. This Mousepad exhibits NONE of those problems. The material has great traction and feels good against the skin too. Do not hesitate to purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse pad for any and ALL use
customer_reviews.text: I was on a MISSION, looking for something great and non-expensive. Ofcourse the VicTSing team came through once again for me! I previously bought a wireless mouse from they that works like a charm, now I have the mouse pad to go with it and it works smoothly! For gaming and normal computer use, whatever you need it for. It works like a charm, I definitely reccomend it to anyone. PLUS the universe design, too cool. Thanks again !
customer_reviews.author: Deveroux

customer_reviews.title: Just right! Especially for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for light gaming and I couldn't be happier. I was not sure at first if I was going to like the stitched border but I love it. It gives me just enough of a reminder or my location on the pad or when I am close to the edge without being intrusive and I love that. It also very thin (I had thick pads), it has the right texture and provides speedy movement without being slippery. Its also what I feel to be the perfect size for me. So many gaming pads are HUGE... srsly- who moves their mouse in that large of an area ever!? LoL
customer_reviews.author: KawaiiGuyy

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these mouse pads in Black and it doesn't work right with my optical mouse. The cursor either doesn't move where I want it to or stops moving or moves in little spurts. I actually thought I would be getting a rigid mouse pad and then see it is just fabric and not rigid. UPDATE! I tried a different Logitech optical wheel mouse now and it works fine..?? Still confused but the mouse pad can be used now.
customer_reviews.author: mrwintr

customer_reviews.title: SHOCKING!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mouse pad because I noticed in the description that it was washable. In the past the decision to purchase a new mouse pad was usually determined by how long I had it and how dirty it was. NEVER did I consider that the look, feel and texture of the mouse pad would make such a HUGE difference. I LOVE THIS PAD! It's surprisingly comfortable. As I glide my mouse across the surface, where my hand does touch the pad, it feels quite nice. The raised-stitched border also helps to keep you from gliding off the pad. Would I recommend? Hell yeah!
customer_reviews.author: Alasandro Birdine

customer_reviews.title: thin and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect mouse pad. It's extremely thing so your wrist does not hang off like it would off many higher ones I've used in the past. The material is soft and comfortable but also works perfectly with my mouse. It's slightly on the larger size so I would check the dimensions before you buy in case you don't have enough space to work with. It also has a clean/sleek all black look with a logo in white in the corner. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a high quality mouse pad!
customer_reviews.author: rowndy

customer_reviews.title: nEW MOUSE DOES NOT TRACK WELL ON HIS PAD
customer_reviews.text: very dissapointed in ths pad, my new wireless mouse does not track well at all on this pad, the surface is not conducive for wireless mouse, My bar stool with a black vinyl cover tracks my mouse movements 100% better, bacxk to using that instead of this pad, wanted something to lay over my leg for my mouse to track on, but even my pant material works better. very dissapointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Thin But Good
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a mouse pad for years that was filled with a sort of gel. Eventually the side fabric eroded away causing the gel to come out and stick to things....time to get a new one. Being an "Amazon Choice" and the right size I bout this product. When it arrived it seem very thin to me (mainly cause my old one was thicker), but it has been perfect. Simple construction that I think works very well. Would not hesitate to recommend or buy!
customer_reviews.author: TRM

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse Mat At A Good Price
customer_reviews.text: My old mouse mat was past due for replacement. Every time I moved it it left sticky black spots on my desks! I haven't shopped for a mouse mat for years but took a chance on this one and I am not disappointed. It seems to be well constructed, it's much thinner than the old-school mouse mats I've always had before, and the grey colors go well with the black and silver of my computer. I'd say this is a good choice if you're in the market for a mouse mat.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Strauss

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mousepad
customer_reviews.text: My old pads were curling up on the sides, so it was time for a new one. The Vic Tsing mouse pad is stay-stiched around the edges. It also has a nice sized surface area for the mouse so I'm not running off the edges. It also just thick enough to not create a strange angle for my wrist when operating the mouse on the pad. I am very happy with it, so far, and look forward to discover if the stay-stiching will keep the edges from curling up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Clarity

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I am unable to rate the ergonomic, comfort or for gaming as it does not have any of those features as I was not looking for them. I was just looking for a flat surface to use with my mouse. I will say the size of it is awesome as it Is wider than regular mouse pads which is great to navigate my 3 screens without having to lift my mouse up and reset it’s position on the pad. As for gaming I do not game so I cannot give it a rating for its gaming performance.
customer_reviews.author: Dimas BENITEZ

customer_reviews.title: Good for price. Good for office work, but not for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly only got it so I actually had a mousepad at work. It feels fairly solid for the price, and it's decent amount of room makes it fine for desk work. By no means would I recommend this for anything gaming related. it's too small, and it's surface isn't the smoothest. It naturally could never compete with something like Steelseries, but I don't think it was ever meant to. For the price? A good office work replacement for hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice, flimsy, black mousepad ... just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I've been coding for decades and well, I. just wanted a thin, plain mousepad and this one works out great. This mousepad is a bit larger than the run of the mill mousepad. Easy to clean. For what it's worth, if/when I need to order another one, I would purchase this one again. I don't know gaming, but I gave it 5 stars for the question since I really like the mousepad. :D
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Love it for gaming and work.
customer_reviews.text: Between gaming work and social media I'm on the computer all day. I was using an old paperback book because I was lazy but I was getting a calloused wrist. I didn't think it would make that big a difference plus I didn't want to spend the money. After enough complaints by my friends for missed shots I decided I would look for a mouse pad. I saw this mousepad for six dollars and figured it probably won't be that good. I was wrong and its great, those bad guys I shoot in games die much faster now. Also my wrist feels great!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Russell

customer_reviews.title: Quality pad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my new mouse and it is real nice. Upon opening, I was very impressed with its sleek design considering it was only $6. This is a very nice mouse pad and I have not had any issues with it after a month of using it. The material is comfortable and doesn't leave any rashes for people with sensitive skin. Highly recommend if you are looking for a quality, affordable mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Acosta

customer_reviews.title: A simple mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: This mousepad does what it's supposed to do, but there is nothing particularly interesting or great about it. I like the surface, which is silky yet has some friction. Its as thin as one of those old rubber jar openers, so my wrist does get a bit achy after a while. I'm using the Anker Vertical Mouse and I love it, so I was hoping for a better experience with the mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Precision combined with quality material.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described and just what I needed. My son is a PC gamer, mostly fps and as soon as I have this for him to use he immediately could tell the difference. The precision was the first thing he said, he told me it felt like he had more control of his movements and then he noted the comfort of the pad itself. Thank you for providing a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Nice value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Been needing a new mouse pad after my previous one of another brand was starting to detach at the edges (the surface material from the foam underneath). Didn't need anything special, so got this one and so far it has been nice! I do like the stitches edges, particularly after my experience with my other mouse pad. This one is a little small, though, so I'll probably consider getting a larger one next time. Still sufficient for my uses, however.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lerma

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these b'c 2 for the price seemed like a good deal. So far they've been great! The rubber-coated bottom ensures that the pad isn't sliding around the surface while I'm trying to work (and I take this thing everywhere). Gaming takes some getting used to, though that's coming from someone who hasn't used a mousepad since like 2005 so my testimony is probably not worth anything. Overall, I would recommend this. I feel like even if I got only 6-7 months before this started falling apart, it would still be worth it for the price. Though I expect it to hold up longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: Kenghis Khan

customer_reviews.title: Good value and performance
customer_reviews.text: I’m working from home on a small computer desk and needed a mouse pad. However, because the desk is narrow, there wasn’t room to place a mousepad next to the keyboard, nor could I find a large pad that fit the entire keyboard tray. The solution? Two VicTsing mouse pads, side-by-side. My keyboard no longer slips and my VicTsing mouse works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ellm

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and great for the price, but not ideal for competitive players
customer_reviews.text: This product for the price is definitely worth the money. If you're a casual gamer or not a gamer at all it'll be good for you. I've only ever used Qck Steelseries mousepads before and compared to their original mousepad I'd say this is slightly grippier. Personally not a fan since I'm big into shooters and such with a lower sensitivity so I prefer a smoother and faster glide than this mousepad offers. Overall if you're a competitive player I'd opt to just spend more money on a better mousepad, but if you're on a budget or don't play at a low sensitivity than this mousepad will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Soft, large, stitched well along the edges.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I bought it to use for work at home since becoming a full-time teleworker. It is large so there is ample space for positioning your hand and maneuvering your mouse. The material is extremely soft to the touch and feels smooth when sliding your hand across it while using the mouse. The stitching around the edges seems well done and secure. Plus the galaxy graphic was an added bonus! 😎
customer_reviews.author: Justin Butler

customer_reviews.title: Better than Most
customer_reviews.text: It functions and is better than most of the pads I've used over the years, but as far as ergonomic, I can't say that it is any better than other flat pads without a wrist support, but as a flat pad, it is thicker and more comfortable than those I have frequently used. It is also the only product I ordered that day that actually works, so I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: GruffOldBear

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but curls after awhile
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these - same exact experience: does the job ok-enough, but after only a few days, it doesn't lay flat; the edges on one side start to curl upward, eventually becoming quite extreme. Trying to reset by folding the newly curled edged down (the other way) doesn't work, either. Why should a mousepad not just lay flat - always?
customer_reviews.author: apollogroove

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but still great.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mouse pad! It feels comfortable, looks great and it's pretty small for any desk setup. I would give it a 5 but there is one problem. I don't know if this is just me or my pad specifically but my pad itself slips and doesn't have the greatest traction ever. Now I'm not saying it slips and slides butter. However overtime of moving my mouse around, say like maybe a couple of hours it slips out of place in small increments. For anyone who is a perfectionist, I probably won't recommend this pad. Other than that, it's still a great pad for any small desk setups out there.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A really good mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new mouse pad for a long time. This one works well with my optical mouse. Good sensitivity, nice and thin, and it's comfortable. The only thing I would improve is to give it a bit more grip on the bottom. It slides around a little more than I'd like. It's better than some other mouse pads, but it could still be improved upon. Overall, it's a great mouse pad for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Phillips

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse pad because I recently got a wireless keyboard and mouse when my keyboard went kaput. Then my new mouse kept sliding off the tray onto the floor. It was a huge hassle. So I had to buy a mousepad. I've only had it a few days but it's working fine to keep the mouse on the tray attached to my stand-up desk.
customer_reviews.author: Shakti

customer_reviews.title: Great Size, Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: The size of this pad is what sold me; it's a bit larger than most. Also the fact that you get two pads makes this a good deal. Traction is good and I like the galaxy design. I would give five stars if the pad was thicker and had no stitching on the edge. The mouse gets stuck on the stitching if you get too close to the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Moi

customer_reviews.title: Dinged for material
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based off the reviews to replace my old laser pad that I've had for forever and it started to crinkle like a potato chip.... This one is much better quality, but I have to move the mouse a lot more around to get where I want the cursor to go compared to my old one the slightest motion would respond where I want it on the computer... If you're looking for a more sensitive pad I guess you'd want to look for a sleeker texture vs this cloth-like one.
customer_reviews.author: NY Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pads!  Excellent quality and value!
customer_reviews.text: These mouse pads are a great value for a 3 pack. They are perfectly sized, they have a good texture on top, and they have a material on the bottom that helps grip the surface the mouse pad is on. The edge has a nice stitching so it doesn't fray like cheaper mouse pads. Overall I give these a 5 star A+ review for value and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Mark V.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, small for gaming
customer_reviews.text: These mouse pads are great! However, if you're a gamer like me, you're probably going to want a bigger sized pad. Stitching and quality is premium, and it will last a long time (even if you have small children). The pad is the standard size but it was advertised as gaming. That's my fault as I should have read the measurements better. Other than the size, no complaints...a deal at $8 for 2.
customer_reviews.author: Cris Paisley

customer_reviews.title: Great pad with only a very minor design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Great pad, i love it. The only downside is the stitched rim acts as a bump stop when your mouse hits it (when gaming it can obstruct and far movement of the mouse), its not a big deal since you don't hit the edge often but I just wanted to mention it since its the only design flaw I found. I still recommend it though.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Gets the Job Done. Decent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap mouse pad. Has stitched edges that will fray eventually. Still gets the job done. I have one at home, one at work, and one for work travel. Does like to collect particles so you may want to vacuum once and a while.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Marks

customer_reviews.title: Very responsive with the mouse, but has a tendancy to slide around
customer_reviews.text: While it's a decent mouse pad, it could be better. One of the corners became folded during shipping, and hasn't flattened out fully since I got it. It also tends to slide around just a bit during use. Another issue I have is the stitched edges. While they're great for durability, they aren't very comfortable to press your wrist against for hours at a time. Would strongly recommend a wrist pad. It is still very responsive to the mouse movements, which is my main concern, so I'm not gonna go through the trouble of returning it for a new one. It does the job it was created for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent overall
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this mousepad. It's well made, maintains low friction with the surfaces I've used it on, and my mouse seems to respond well with it. No marked scientific improvement over other mousepads, but my old one does not seem to have the same resolution I get with this one. Regardless of marketing or placebo effect, I am happy with the performance and construction of the mousepad so far. Time will tell what it's made of... Hopefully not another fly-by-night piece of garbage only a year from now, but I expect it to last much longer based on experience.
customer_reviews.author: Calum Rife

customer_reviews.title: Good solid low price mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: What can I say other then it's great for the price. Sure it's a bit on the thin side, but it's a cheaper priced pad. Otherwise it's a great size, nice and smooth, and the stitching around the edges will help it hold up without stretching out or separating for quite some time. I love it and will easy purchase another one again in the future
customer_reviews.author: JkPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as more expensive options
customer_reviews.text: Bought about 5 of these originally as a alternative to the much more expensive steel series mouse pads as they are about 3 times the price. They are absolutely just as good in every way and likely the same exact thing just with a different brand name on them. I see no reason to ever buy the steel series ones again.
customer_reviews.author: Leichter

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad that does not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: The pad is just the right size for my desk and is not too thick or inflexible. The pad is made of durable material without sacrificing comfort. All my mice, from the wireless gaming and work one to my old wired mouse work flawlessly on the pad. I also got the galaxy design that actually lives up to the picture in the listing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Majano

customer_reviews.title: Threads along the edge are coming up
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is pretty great. It stays in place well, is a decent size, and isn’t super thick. The only issue I’m starting to see is that the stitched edges are start to fray after about 1 1/2 months, but nothing major yet. I’ll update this review if it gets out of hand in an unreasonable length of time.
customer_reviews.author: King Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected, but still great value for price
customer_reviews.text: The mousepad is clearly not the highest quality material, but it’s honestly super good for how much it costs. I should have looked at the sizing so that is my fault! I suppose the mouse pad being a bit bigger than expected would be a bonus for some because it gives more space to move the mouse around, but I only have a small space next to my keyboard so the size isn’t the best for me. The pad doesn’t slide or catch on anything, overall super worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: The fabric has a slight nap
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is just okay. The size is good, it sits flat on the desk and is well made. The fabric surface on the grey one has a slight nap to it. So it feels smooth in one direction, but a bit coarse in another directions. Not a big deal. Just wish it was a little smoother in all directions.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted in a mousepad
customer_reviews.text: I use an Apple Magic Mouse, which requires a non-reflective surface to work correctly. This mousepad provides a secure surface with just enough grip to keep the mouse in place, but no friction when moving it around. It's flexible, so easy to relocate for travel or changing work stations. It's also easy to clean, shakes out and wipes off without staining. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Enright

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I know mouse pads are supposed to be old news, but when your mouse isn't grabbing the surface and moving correctly, it may be just what you need. This mouse pad is thin enough and the perfect size. The only way they could improve would be to put a stiff cardboard in the envelope so that it doesn't come bent with a crease in it, like the first one did. I ordered a replacement, and the second one looks great. No more mouse frustration!
customer_reviews.author: Bubbly

product_meta.title: VicTsing Mouse Pad with Stitched Edge, Premium-Textured Mouse Mat, Non-Slip Rubber Base Mousepad for Laptop, Computer & PC, 10.2×8.3×0.08 inches, Black
product_meta.description:
Style:1 pack| Color:BlackWith a superbly smooth surface and anti-slip natural rubber base, this mouse mat is designed to assist and enhance the performance of your mouse. Ideal choice for game, work or daily use.

Smooth Movement
Premium-textured and large size surface ensure full movement and accurate positioning. The mouse can move quickly and smoothly.

Durable Design
Delicate reinforced stitched edges to prevent wear, deformation and damage. Design for security and durability

Anti-skid Bottom
Made from natural rubber, the base can be firmly attached to the desktop and prevent the mat from slipping.

Easy to Clean
Liquid stains on the surface can be washed away. After drying, the mat can continue to be used.

Nature Friendly Material
Environmental protection natural rubber material is certified by RoHS and has no health hazard.

Specification
Color: Black
Product Size: 260×210×2mm/10.2×8.3×0.08 in

Package Included: 
1 ×Mouse Mat
feature_bullets: ✔【Durable Stitched Edges. 】 This mouse pad has delicate edges which can prevent wear. Ensure prolonged use without deformation and degumming.
✔【Ultra-smooth Surface. 】 Texture is denser with 230°F and high pressure treatment. Mouse can be quickly moved and accurately positioned on the slick surface. Great for your work and gaming.
✔【Non-slip rubber base. 】 Dense shading and anti-slip natural rubber base can firmly grip the desktop. Premium soft material for your comfort and mouse-control.
✔【Wide Applicability.】 Available for all types of mouse, LASER & OPTICAL. Ideal size for daily use. 2mm thickness to adapt to all surfaces.

✔【Washable Design and Fade Prevent. 】 This mouse mat is made of which has great locking-color effect. Liquid stains can be cleaned with water for continuous use. And it will not fade with repeated cleaning.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars15,623 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
